Label.text: Privacy Policy

Android Safe Box Pro is a mobile application developed by Tech Stuff House that allows users to store any text data on the device where the application is installed, using a database encrypted with 256-bit AES encryption. The app has the following privacy policy:
1. The data saved in the app isn't sent over the internet.
2. The data you choose to store in the encrypted database can only be accessed in the app by providing the password used to encrypt it.
3. As this app displays ads provided by Google Admob, Google may collect data to serve better targeted ads to the user. The types of data that Google may use include:
* IP address, which may be used to estimate the general location of a device.
* Non-user related crash logs.
* User-associated performance data such as app launch time, hang rate, or energy usage.
* A Device ID such as the device's advertising identifier or other app-bounded device identifiers, which may be used for the purpose of third-party advertising and analytics.
* Advertising data, such as advertisements the user has seen, may be used to power analytics and advertising features.
* Other user product interactions like app launch taps, and interaction information, like video views, may be used to improve advertising performance.
Terms of Service

1. This app only stores your data on the device where it is installed. If you want to access your data on a different device, you must back up the database and manually transfer it to another Android device.
2. The password used to encrypt the database cannot be recovered in any way. If you forget your password, you will not be able to access your data anymore.
3. To change your password, you must provide your current password.
4. If you change your password after making a backup, you will need your previous password to access the data in the backup.
5. If you uninstall or delete this app, you can only recover your data if you backed up the database.
6. If you lose access to the device or the Android system where the app is installed, you can only recover your data if you backed up the database and transferred it to another location.

7. On Android 11 and above, the import feature works until the app is uninstalled or deleted. If you perform a backup and then uninstall the app, the backup file can't be imported automatically. In that case, you can use a device with Android 10 or below, or you can manually import the file to the app folder (requires the device to be rooted).

8. Due to the variety of smartphones and Android customization available in the market, the app may not recognize your device storage when you try to make or import a backup. In that case, you should contact us, so we can try to add support to your device storage, although we do not guarantee that will be possible.

9.
